Plot: ADVISE AND CONSENT is a study of political animals in their natural habitat and is universally recognized as THE Washington novel. It begins with Senate confirmation hearings for a liberal Secretary of State and concludes two weeks later, after debate and controversy have exploded this issue into a major crisis. "I can recall no other novel in which there is so well presented a president's dilemma when his awful responsibility for the nation's interest conflicts with a personal code of good morals." (The New York Times)
Characters: Seabright B. Cooley, Robert Durham Munson, Brigham M. Anderson, Orrin Knox, Stanley Danta, Robert A. Leffingwell, Hal Fry, Harley Hudson, Thomas August, Lafe Smith, Fred Van Ackerman
